## Useful Info

**Pandemonium lords** (**pan lords**) are powerful, semi-random [demons](/Demon "Demon") who rule over [Pandemonium](/Pandemonium "Pandemonium"). All pan lords have a few things in common: see invisible and demonic resistances. They are otherwise unpredictable, with variable speed, defenses, [spell](/Spell "Spell") sets, etc.

In Pandemonium, there is usually one pan lord per floor, who may be wandering on the floor or placed in a [vault](/Vault "Vault"). These vaults can have a 11.1% or 100% chance - depending on the vault - to have the demonic rune. Pan lords also spawn on the [orb run](/Orb_run "Orb run"), where multiple lords can be on the same floor. In addition, chaos-themed [Ziggurat](/Ziggurat "Ziggurat") floors can have many, many pan lords.

## Properties

Pan lords are semi-randomly generated, but their potential properties, while complex, can be enumerated:[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

### Base properties

- HP: `100 + 3d50` (103-250)
  - Non-casters get 50% more HP.

- Total defense (AC + EV): 10-49

  - AC: 1-45

  - EV: 1-45

    - Pan lord AC/EV tend to be weighted towards one or the other.
    - Non-casters get +5 AC and +5 EV.

- HD: `10 + 2d10` (12-30)
  - Non-casters get +5 HD.

- Speed:

  - Non-casters: `11 + 2d4` (13-19)
  - Casters: 33% chance of being speed 10, otherwise `8 + 2d5` (10-18)

- Melee damage: one attack, with a maximum damage of `20 + 2d20` (22-60).
  - Non-casters get +10 damage.

- Melee attack flavor: 33% chance of having an attack flavor. The table below shows the chance of a given brand being picked:[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

| [Attack flavours](/Attack_flavour "Attack flavour")                                              | Chance |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ------ |
| [Antimagic](/Category:Antimagic_flavour "Category:Antimagic flavour")                            | 10%    |
| [Chaos](/Category:Chaos_flavour "Category:Chaos flavour")                                        | 10%    |
| [Distortion](/Category:Distort_flavour "Category:Distort flavour")                               | 10%    |
| [Trample](/Category:Trample_flavour "Category:Trample flavour")                                  | 10%    |
| [Corrode](/Category:Corrode_flavour "Category:Corrode flavour")                                  | 5%     |
| [Drag](/Category:Drag_flavour "Category:Drag flavour")                                           | 5%     |
| [Drain speed](/Category:Drain_speed_flavour "Category:Drain speed flavour")                      | 5%     |
| [Electrocution](/Category:Electricity_flavour "Category:Electricity flavour")                    | 5%     |
| [Ensnare](/Category:Ensnare_flavour "Category:Ensnare flavour")                                  | 5%     |
| [Flaming](/Category:Fire_flavour "Category:Fire flavour")                                        | 5%     |
| [Freezing](/Category:Cold_flavour "Category:Cold flavour")                                       | 5%     |
| [Pain](/Category:Pain_flavour "Category:Pain flavour")                                           | 5%     |
| [Vampirism](/Category:Vampiric_flavour "Category:Vampiric flavour")                              | 5%     |
| [Weakness](/Category:Weakness_flavour "Category:Weakness flavour")                               | 5%     |
| [Draining](/Category:Drain_experience_flavour "Category:Drain experience flavour")               | 2.5%   |
| [Drown](/Category:Drown_flavour "Category:Drown flavour")                                        | 2.5%   |
| [Venom](/Category:Poison_flavour "Category:Poison flavour")                                      | 2.5%   |
| [Drain Intelligence](/Category:Drain_intelligence_flavour "Category:Drain intelligence flavour") | 1%     |
| [Drain Strength](/Category:Drain_strength_flavour "Category:Drain strength flavour")             | 1%     |
| [Drain Dexterity](/Category:Drain_dexterity_flavour "Category:Drain dexterity flavour")          | 0.5%   |

- Non-casters will always get a melee brand.

### Resistances and Intrinsics

- Flight: 2/3 chance.

- Fire and cold resistance:

  - 10% chance of being vulnerable (rF- / rC-)
  - 30% chance of having no resistance
  - 30% chance of having one level of the resistance (rF+ / rC+)
  - 20% chance of having two levels of the resistance (rF++ / rC++)
  - 10% chance of being immune (rF+++ / rC+++)

- Electricity resistance: 60% chance of having a single level of electricity resistance and 10% chance of being immune to electricity.

- Always have the standard demonic resistances (poison, negative energy, torment) and [see invisible](/See_invisible "See invisible").

### Spellcasting

Pan lords have a 75% chance of being spellcasters. Non-casters gain some bonuses to defenses, melee and speed, as seen above. Pan lords who are spellcasters are given spells from fixed lists.

- Slot 1. 90% chance to get a conjuration spell: [Call Down Damnation](/Call_Down_Damnation "Call Down Damnation"), [Lehudib's Crystal Spear](/Lehudib%27s_Crystal_Spear "Lehudib's Crystal Spear"), [Corrosive Bolt](/Corrosive_Bolt "Corrosive Bolt"), [Quicksilver Bolt](/Quicksilver_Bolt "Quicksilver Bolt"), [Orb of Destruction](/Orb_of_Destruction "Orb of Destruction"), [Bolt of Devastation](/Bolt_of_Devastation "Bolt of Devastation"), [Mindburst](/Mindburst "Mindburst"), [Bolt of Fire](/Bolt_of_Fire "Bolt of Fire"), [Bolt of Cold](/Bolt_of_Cold "Bolt of Cold"), [Iron Shot](/Iron_Shot "Iron Shot"), [Poison Arrow](/Poison_Arrow "Poison Arrow"), [Bolt of Draining](/Bolt_of_Draining "Bolt of Draining"), or [Lightning Bolt](/Lightning_Bolt "Lightning Bolt").

- Slot 2. 90% chance to get a summoning spell **or** an AOE conjuration spell (even chance of each):

  - Summoning spells:

    - [Haunt](/Haunt "Haunt"), [Malign Gateway](/Malign_Gateway "Malign Gateway"), [Summon Dragon](/Summon_Dragon "Summon Dragon"), [Summon Horrible Things](/Summon_Horrible_Things "Summon Horrible Things"), [Summon Eyeballs](/Summon_Eyeballs "Summon Eyeballs"), or [Summon Vermin](/Summon_Vermin "Summon Vermin").
    - OR [Summon Demon](/Summon_Demon "Summon Demon") or [Summon Greater Demon](/Summon_Greater_Demon "Summon Greater Demon").
    - Summoners without Summon (Greater) Demon spell have a 50% chance to get [Blink Allies Encircling](/Blink_Allies_Encircling "Blink Allies Encircling").

  - AOE conjuration spells: [Symbol of Torment](/Symbol_of_Torment "Symbol of Torment"), [Fire Storm](/Fire_Storm "Fire Storm"), [Glaciate](/Glaciate "Glaciate"), [Chain Lightning](/Chain_Lightning "Chain Lightning"), [Freezing Cloud](/Freezing_Cloud "Freezing Cloud"), [Poisonous Cloud](/Poisonous_Cloud "Poisonous Cloud"), [Metal Splinters](/Metal_Splinters "Metal Splinters"), [Energy Bolt](/Energy_Bolt "Energy Bolt"), [Orb of Electricity](/Orb_of_Electrocution "Orb of Electrocution"), or [Conjure Ball Lightning](/Conjure_Ball_Lightning "Conjure Ball Lightning").

- Slot 3. 50% chance to get a self-enchantment spell: [Haste](/Haste "Haste"), [Silence](/Silence "Silence"), [Invisibility](/Invisibility "Invisibility"), [Blink](/Blink "Blink"), or [Blink Range](/Blink_Range "Blink Range").

- Slot 4. 50% chance to get a spell from the misc spell list: [Dispel Undead Range](/Dispel_Undead_Range "Dispel Undead Range"), [Paralyse](/Paralyse "Paralyse"), [Sleep](/Sleep "Sleep"), [Mass Confusion](/Mass_Confusion "Mass Confusion"), [Drain Magic](/Drain_Magic "Drain Magic"), [Petrify](/Petrify "Petrify"), [Polymorph](/Polymorph "Polymorph"), [Force Lance](/Force_Lance "Force Lance"), [Slow](/Slow "Slow"), [Sentinel's Mark](/Sentinel%27s_Mark "Sentinel's Mark"), or [Dimension Anchor](/Dimension_Anchor "Dimension Anchor").

Non-casters have a 33% chance to get one "spell" from the following list: [Blinkbolt](/Blinkbolt "Blinkbolt"), [Blink Close](/Blink_Close "Blink Close"), or [Harpoon Shot](/Harpoon_Shot "Harpoon Shot").

Obviously, this produces widely varied spell lists. In theory, it could range from a demon possessing only [Blink](/Blink "Blink") to a monstrosity with [Fire Storm](/Fire_Storm "Fire Storm"), [Lehudib's Crystal Spear](/Lehudib%27s_Crystal_Spear "Lehudib's Crystal Spear"), [Haste](/Haste "Haste"), and [Paralyse](/Paralyse "Paralyse").

## Cloud rings

Non-casters and casters with AOE conjuration spells have a 1/7 chance to have a ring of [clouds](/Clouds "Clouds"):

- thunder clouds, 22%
- flame clouds, 22%
- freezing clouds, 22%
- clouds of negative energy, 11%
- clouds of seething chaos, \~6%
- acidic clouds, \~6%
- miasma clouds, \~6%
- mutagenic clouds, \~6%.

## Uniques

There are four [unique](/Unique "Unique"), fixed Pan lords:

- & [![Cerebov.png](/images/c/c5/Cerebov.png)](/File:Cerebov.png) **[Cerebov](/Cerebov "Cerebov")**, guarding the fiery rune of Zot.
- & [![Gloorx Vloq.png](/images/9/97/Gloorx_Vloq.png)](/File:Gloorx_Vloq.png) **[Gloorx Vloq](/Gloorx_Vloq "Gloorx Vloq")**, guarding the dark rune of Zot.
- & [![Lom Lobon.png](/images/f/f6/Lom_Lobon.png)](/File:Lom_Lobon.png) **[Lom Lobon](/Lom_Lobon "Lom Lobon")**, guarding the magical rune of Zot.
- & [![Mnoleg.png](/images/a/ad/Mnoleg.png)](/File:Mnoleg.png) **[Mnoleg](/Mnoleg "Mnoleg")**, guarding the glowing rune of Zot.

Only Cerebov has loot. The game will alert you when you enter the realm of one of these lords; you can check the milestones by pressing **?:** keys to see which lord's realm you have entered.

Be careful: if you leave the level before getting the rune (except through [banishment](/Banishment "Banishment")), you will not be able to get the rune that game, and thus cannot do an all-rune ascension.

Should you pick up the rune on a unique Pan lord's level *without* killing them, they will randomly spawn on all subsequent Pan levels and the [orb run](/Orb_run "Orb run") until you do kill them.

## Tips & Tricks

- Checking out a pan lord's stats is highly recommended. You might be up against a brutal [crystal spear](/Crystal_spear "Crystal spear") + [Fire Storm](/Fire_Storm "Fire Storm") caster, a very fast [Silencing](/Silence "Silence") pan lord with [torment](/Torment "Torment"), or a wimp with nothing but [Drain Magic](/Drain_Magic "Drain Magic").
- Killing them quickly is entirely appropriate, especially when facing multiple lords at once.
- Having a spread of resistances helps. [Fire](/Fire "Fire")/[cold](/Cold "Cold")/[electricity](/Electricity "Electricity") resistance is good against the level 9 spells, [torment](/Torment "Torment") resistance is good for all of Pandemonium, and [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") is essential against their hexes. More unusually, be prepared to wipe out a group of eye-type monsters from [Summon Eyeballs](/Summon_Eyeballs "Summon Eyeballs") - [floating eyes](/Floating_eye "Floating eye") can paralyse in 2 turns, which can be instant death.
- Pandemonium lords are not immune to [throwing nets](/Throwing_net "Throwing net"). While a fast panlord may break through quickly, throwing a net is not a bad idea during the [orb run](/Orb_run "Orb run").

## History

- In [0.26](/0.26 "0.26"), Pan lords got new spells and attack types. Also, some Pan lords have a ring of dangerous [clouds](/Clouds "Clouds") around them.
- Prior to [0.23](/0.23 "0.23"), Pan lords' spell sets and attack brands were not revealed. Also, followers of [Elyvilon](/Elyvilon "Elyvilon") could pacify them.
- Prior to [0.21](/0.21 "0.21"), Pan lords could cast [Shatter](/Shatter "Shatter").
- Prior to [0.18](/0.18 "0.18"), Pan lords had more spells on average, but some of those spells were weaker (e.g. [Throw Icicle](/Throw_Icicle "Throw Icicle") or [Throw Flame](/Throw_Flame "Throw Flame")). Also, non-caster Pan lords didn't have offense and defense bonuses.
- Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), Pan lords could not get [Quicksilver Bolt](/Quicksilver_Bolt "Quicksilver Bolt") instead of IMB in their second slot, and could not get [Orb of Electricity](/Orb_of_Electrocution "Orb of Electrocution") in their first slot. Also, the proportion of non-casters was 1/3 instead of 1/4, and not all Pan lords could see invisible.
- Prior to [0.9](/0.9 "0.9"), demonic runes would continue to spawn even if you already had one, allowing for truly ridiculous high scores.

## References

2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [ghost.cc:226](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.31.0/crawl-ref/source/ghost.cc#L226) (0.31.0)

      • Haunt, Malign Gateway, Summon Dragon, Summon Horrible Things, Summon Eyeballs, or Summon Vermin.
      • OR Summon Demon or Summon Greater Demon.
      • Summoners without Summon (Greater) Demon spell have a 50% chance to get Blink Allies Encircling.
    • AOE conjuration spells: Symbol of Torment, Fire Storm, Glaciate, Chain Lightning, Freezing Cloud, Poisonous Cloud, Metal Splinters, Energy Bolt, Orb of Electricity, or Conjure Ball Lightning.
  • Slot 3. 50% chance to get a self-enchantment spell: Haste, Silence, Invisibility, Blink, or Blink Range.
  • Slot 4. 50% chance to get a spell from the misc spell list: Dispel Undead Range, Paralyse, Sleep, Mass Confusion, Drain Magic, Petrify, Polymorph, Force Lance, Slow, Sentinel's Mark, or Dimension Anchor.

  • freezing clouds, 22%
  • clouds of negative energy, 11%

Uniques

  • & Cerebov, guarding the fiery rune of Zot.
  • & Gloorx Vloq, guarding the dark rune of Zot.
  • & Lom Lobon, guarding the magical rune of Zot.

  • Killing them quickly is entirely appropriate, especially when facing multiple lords at once.
  • Having a spread of resistances helps. Fire/cold/electricity resistance is good against the level 9 spells, torment resistance is good for all of Pandemonium, and willpower is essential against their hexes. All pan lords have a few things in common: see invisible and demonic resistances. They are otherwise unpredictable, with variable speed, defenses, [[spell]] sets, etc. In Pandemonium, there is usually one pan lord per floor, who may be wandering on the floor or placed in a [[vault]]. These vaults can have a 11.1% or 100% chance - depending on the vault - to have the demonic rune. Pan lords also spawn on the [[orb run]], where multiple lords can be on the same floor. In addition, chaos-themed [[Ziggurat]] floors can have many, many pan lords. ==Properties== Pan lords are semi-randomly generated, but their potential properties, while complex, can be enumerated:{{source ref|0.31.0|ghost.cc|298}} ===Base properties=== *HP: 100 + 3d50 (103-250) **Non-casters get 50% more HP. *Total defense (AC + EV): 10-49 **AC: 1-45 **EV: 1-45 ***Pan lord AC/EV tend to be weighted towards one or the other. ***Non-casters get +5 AC and +5 EV. *HD: 10 + 2d10 (12-30) **Non-casters get +5 HD. *Speed: **Non-casters: 11 + 2d4 (13-19) **Casters: 33% chance of being speed 10, otherwise 8 + 2d5 (10-18) *Melee damage: one attack, with a maximum damage of 20 + 2d20 (22-60). **Non-casters get +10 damage. *Melee attack flavor: 33% chance of having an attack flavor. The table below shows the chance of a given brand being picked:{{source ref|0.31.0|ghost.cc|226}} {|class="wikitable" !colspan=1|[[Attack flavour]]s || Chance |- |[[:Category:Antimagic_flavour|Antimagic]] || 10% |- |[[:Category:Chaos_flavour|Chaos]] || 10% |- |[[:Category:Distort_flavour|Distortion]] || 10% |- |[[:Category:Trample_flavour|Trample]] || 10% |- |[[:Category:Corrode_flavour|Corrode]] || 5% |- |[[:Category:Drag_flavour|Drag]] || 5% |- |[[:Category:Drain_speed_flavour|Drain speed]] || 5% |- |[[:Category:Electricity_flavour|Electrocution]] || 5% |- |[[:Category:Ensnare_flavour|Ensnare]] || 5% |- |[[:Category:Fire_flavour|Flaming]] || 5% |- |[[:Category:Cold_flavour|Freezing]] || 5% |- |[[:Category:Pain_flavour|Pain]] || 5% |- |[[:Category:Vampiric_flavour|Vampirism]] || 5% |- |[[:Category:Weakness_flavour|Weakness]] || 5% |- |[[:Category:Drain_experience_flavour|Draining]] || 2.5% |- |[[:Category:Drown_flavour|Drown]] || 2.5% |- |[[:Category:Poison_flavour|Venom]] || 2.5% |- |[[:Category:Drain_intelligence_flavour|Drain Intelligence]] || 1% |- |[[:Category:Drain_strength_flavour|Drain Strength]] || 1% |- |[[:Category:Drain_dexterity_flavour|Drain Dexterity]] || 0.5% |} *Non-casters will always get a melee brand. ===Resistances and Intrinsics=== *Flight: 2/3 chance. *Fire and cold resistance: **10% chance of being vulnerable (rF- / rC-) **30% chance of having no resistance **30% chance of having one level of the resistance (rF+ / rC+) **20% chance of having two levels of the resistance (rF++ / rC++) **10% chance of being immune (rF+++ / rC+++) *Electricity resistance: 60% chance of having a single level of electricity resistance and 10% chance of being immune to electricity. *Always have the standard demonic resistances (poison, negative energy, torment) and [[see invisible]]. ===Spellcasting=== Pan lords have a 75% chance of being spellcasters. Non-casters gain some bonuses to defenses, melee and speed, as seen above. Pan lords who are spellcasters are given spells from fixed lists. *Slot 1. 90% chance to get a conjuration spell: [[Call Down Damnation]], [[Lehudib's Crystal Spear]], [[Corrosive Bolt]], [[Quicksilver Bolt]], [[Orb of Destruction]], [[Bolt of Devastation]], [[Mindburst]], [[Bolt of Fire]], [[Bolt of Cold]], [[Iron Shot]], [[Poison Arrow]], [[Bolt of Draining]], or [[Lightning Bolt]]. *Slot 2. 90% chance to get a summoning spell '''or''' an AOE conjuration spell (even chance of each): **Summoning spells: ***[[Haunt]], [[Malign Gateway]], [[Summon Dragon]], [[Summon Horrible Things]], [[Summon Eyeballs]], or [[Summon Vermin]]. ***OR [[Summon Demon]] or [[Summon Greater Demon]]. ***Summoners without Summon (Greater) Demon spell have a 50% chance to get [[Blink Allies Encircling]]. **AOE conjuration spells: [[Symbol of Torment]], [[Fire Storm]], [[Glaciate]], [[Chain Lightning]], [[Freezing Cloud]], [[Poisonous Cloud]], [[Metal Splinters]], [[Energy Bolt]], [[Orb of Electrocution|Orb of Electricity]], or [[Conjure Ball Lightning]]. *Slot 3. 50% chance to get a self-enchantment spell: [[Haste]], [[Silence]], [[Invisibility]], [[Blink]], or [[Blink Range]]. *Slot 4. 50% chance to get a spell from the misc spell list: [[Dispel Undead Range]], [[Paralyse]], [[Sleep]], [[Mass Confusion]], [[Drain Magic]], [[Petrify]], [[Polymorph]], [[Force Lance]], [[Slow]], [[Sentinel's Mark]], or [[Dimension Anchor]]. Non-casters have a 33% chance to get one "spell" from the following list: [[Blinkbolt]], [[Blink Close]], or [[Harpoon Shot]]. Obviously, this produces widely varied spell lists. In theory, it could range from a demon possessing only [[Blink]] to a monstrosity with [[Fire Storm]], [[Lehudib's Crystal Spear]], [[Haste]], and [[Paralyse]]. ==Cloud rings== Non-casters and casters with AOE conjuration spells have a 1/7 chance to have a ring of [[clouds]]: *thunder clouds, 22% *flame clouds, 22% *freezing clouds, 22% *clouds of negative energy, 11% *clouds of seething chaos, ~6% *acidic clouds, ~6% *miasma clouds, ~6% *mutagenic clouds, ~6%. ==Uniques== There are four [[unique]], fixed Pan lords: *{{monsterlink|Cerebov}}, guarding the fiery rune of Zot. *{{monsterlink|Gloorx Vloq}}, guarding the dark rune of Zot. *{{monsterlink|Lom Lobon}}, guarding the magical rune of Zot. *{{monsterlink|Mnoleg}}, guarding the glowing rune of Zot. Only Cerebov has loot. The game will alert you when you enter the realm of one of these lords; you can check the milestones by pressing '''?:''' keys to see which lord's realm you have entered. Be careful: if you leave the level before getting the rune (except through [[banishment]]), you will not be able to get the rune that game, and thus cannot do an all-rune ascension. Should you pick up the rune on a unique Pan lord's level ''without'' killing them, they will randomly spawn on all subsequent Pan levels and the [[orb run]] until you do kill them. ==Tips & Tricks== *Checking out a pan lord's stats is highly recommended. You might be up against a brutal [[crystal spear]] + [[Fire Storm]] caster, a very fast [[Silence|Silencing]] pan lord with [[torment]], or a wimp with nothing but [[Drain Magic]]. *Killing them quickly is entirely appropriate, especially when facing multiple lords at once. *Having a spread of resistances helps. [[Fire]]/[[cold]]/[[electricity]] resistance is good against the level 9 spells, [[torment]] resistance is good for all of Pandemonium, and [[willpower]] is essential against their hexes. More unusually, be prepared to wipe out a group of eye-type monsters from [[Summon Eyeballs]] - [[floating eye]]s can paralyse in 2 turns, which can be instant death. *Pandemonium lords are not immune to [[throwing net]]s. While a fast panlord may break through quickly, throwing a net is not a bad idea during the [[orb run]]. ==History== *In [[0.26]], Pan lords got new spells and attack types. Also, some Pan lords have a ring of dangerous [[clouds]] around them. *Prior to [[0.23]], Pan lords' spell sets and attack brands were not revealed. Also, followers of [[Elyvilon]] could pacify them. *Prior to [[0.21]], Pan lords could cast [[Shatter]]. *Prior to [[0.18]], Pan lords had more spells on average, but some of those spells were weaker (e.g. [[Throw Icicle]] or [[Throw Flame]]). Also, non-caster Pan lords didn't have offense and defense bonuses. *Prior to [[0.14]], Pan lords could not get [[Quicksilver Bolt]] instead of IMB in their second slot, and could not get [[Orb of Electrocution|Orb of Electricity]] in their first slot. Also, the proportion of non-casters was 1/3 instead of 1/4, and not all Pan lords could see invisible. *Prior to [[0.9]], demonic runes would continue to spawn even if you already had one, allowing for truly ridiculous high scores. ==References==
